author: Helena Horton
title: Did the Coca-Cola Super Bowl advert make a dig at Donald Trump?
text:
M any thought the Coca-Cola Superbowl advert was aimed at President Trump.
The advertisement showed a message of diversity and inclusion, and included people of many different faiths and backgrounds.
It was also sound tracked by 'America The Beautiful' in three languages.
Although it doesn't mention Donald Trump, many thought the fact it celebrated diversity showed it was a dig aimed at the President.
Here's the Coke ad that ran tonight‚Äîit's basically one big subtweet of Trump. pic.twitter.com/a6CYdTSnsw 
‚Äî Kyle Griffin (@kylegriffin1) February 5, 2017 S ome supporters of the President even said they'd be boycotting the soft drink over the perceived slight.
However, the advert was made in 2014, before we could even imagine Donald Trump becoming president.
Watch | Airbnb says 'we accept' in Super Bowl LI ad 00:32 C oca-Cola notes that it has continued to run the "It's Beautiful" ad during major TV events, and says it "makes sense" to air it before the Super Bowl this year.
